content.title: Hita-dhikaari Ke Samanye Athava Durghatana Me Mrityu Ya Ghayal Hone Ki Dasha Me Sahayata Yojana
content.details: The Beneficiary's Death or Injury Assistance Scheme, established by the Labor department of Rajasthan State, is a compassionate government program designed to offer a helping hand to families of beneficiaries who have experienced the loss of a loved one or the sudden hardship of an injury, regardless of whether the cause was natural or accidental. Recognizing the significant emotional and financial strain that such events can inflict, this initiative aims to provide a measure of financial security during these difficult times, allowing families to focus on healing and rebuilding their lives.
benefits: In case of death due to accident: ₹5,00,000/-
In case of permanent total disability due to accident: ₹3,00,000/-
In case of partial permanent disability due to accident: ₹1,00,000/-
In case of serious injury in an accident: Up to ₹20,000/-
In case of minor injuries in an accident: Up to ₹5,000/-
In case of normal death of a construction worker: ₹75,000/-
eligibility: Construction workers must be between 18 to 60 years of age.
Construction workers must be registered with the labor board.
Construction workers must be depositing their contributions regularly.
exclusions: Death due to suicide or consumption of drugs or substances.
In case of death or injury due to fighting with each other in violation of the law for committing a crime.
documents_required: Copy of discharge ticket from hospital in case of accident.
Copy of mortuary report or FIR in case of accidental death.
Death certificate issued by the registered authority in case of death.
Certificate from the employer/employer of the place where the worker worked.
Copy of beneficiary registration identity card or card.
Copy of Bhamshah family card or Bhamshah nomination.
Copy of first page of bank account passbook.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Providing financial assistance in case of natural or accidental death or injury of the beneficiary by the Building Labor Welfare Department.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided under the scheme?
May Other State persons also apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is currently limited to Rajasthan.

faqs.question: What amount of benefits is provided in cases of death?
faqs.answer: In case of death due to accident: ₹5,00,000/-; In case of normal death of a construction worker: ₹75,000/-.

faqs.question: What amount of benefits is provided in case of permanent disability?
faqs.answer: In case of permanent total disability due to accident: ₹3,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What amount of benefits is provided in cases of partial permanent disability?
faqs.answer: In case of partial permanent disability due to accident: ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What amount of benefits is provided in cases of minor injuries?
faqs.answer: In case of minor injuries in an accident: Up to ₹5,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the eligible age to get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Construction workers must be between 18 to 60 years of age.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: Copy of discharge ticket from hospital in case of accident; Copy of mortuary report or FIR in case of accidental death; Death certificate issued by the registered authority in case of death; Certificate from the employer/employer of the place where the worker worked; Copy of beneficiary registration identity card or card; Copy of Bhamshah family card or Bhamshah nomination; Copy of Aadhar Card; Copy of first page of bank account passbook.

faqs.question: What is the official portal to apply online?
faqs.answer: Follow the below URL Link: https://sso.rajasthan.gov.in/signin.
